Articles.Content: A perfect little launch and escape vehicle for my station. Couple things I did notice though, there is no power flowing though the solar panel and it is drifting off the retrograde in a free descent through the atmosphere with the pica heat shield. I added the CoP and the CoL offsets from the 2.5 stock heat shield to the config and that did help.

A perfect little launch and escape vehicle for my station. Couple things I did notice though, there is no power flowing though the solar panel and it is drifting off the retrograde in a free descent through the atmosphere with the pica heat shield. I added the CoP and the CoL offsets from the 2.5 stock heat shield to the config and that did help.

I'll see what I can do, hopefully I can get one more fix in tonight.

EDIT: No idea what is going on with the solar panels, they seem to be getting power from the other side of the trunk (the non panel side)...

Edited June 9, 2015 by tygoo7

Hey Tygoo,

I just wanted to let you know I really love this mod already even when I just downloaded it for a few minutes... It's so awsome, good work! ^^

I'd love it even more with IVA And maybe the amount of monoprop that is located in the capsule is a bit too much.

Thanks for making this mod ;3

I don't know if you intended the inside top of the pod to be diagonal, I'm not a fan of it..

Edited June 9, 2015 by Kaname

The new pod looks magnificent Trying it out.

On a side note: Apply smoothing manually to those polygons inside window frames, the ones perpendicularily to the surface.

Also, are horizontal RCS ports blowing outside, towards SuperDraco pods, or the inside? From the testure looks like the second, but from the logic IMO first is better.

I noticed the trunk, seems to have the solar sides reversed. The side without the blue-paneled texture provides power when exposed to the sun. When the side with the blue paneled texture is turned to the sun, there is no Energy Flow and no Sun Exposure.

Edited June 10, 2015 by Haze-Zero

Sorry for not posting any fix the trunk or heatshield thing yet since I was kind of busy with some dragons yesterday. I'll get a fix out today!

I noticed the trunk, seems to have the solar sides reversed. The side without the blue-paneled texture provides power when exposed to the sun. When the side with the blue paneled texture is turned to the sun, there is no Energy Flow and no Sun Exposure.

Yes, this is a known issue, I am still trying to find a way to fix it or see what is causing it.

The new pod looks magnificent Trying it out.

On a side note: Apply smoothing manually to those polygons inside window frames, the ones perpendicularily to the surface.

Also, are horizontal RCS ports blowing outside, towards SuperDraco pods, or the inside? From the testure looks like the second, but from the logic IMO first is better.

The horizontal ports blow away from the SuperDraco pods.

Thank you! I do plan to make an IVA for it, eventually. The top is suppose to be diagonal because that's what the actual dragon top is, the docking port is straight though.
What was wrong with the old IVA, I thought it was good ?

What was wrong with the old IVA, I thought it was good ?

It doesn't really fit well with the new pod I think. Like the windows are different and stuff.

I literally do not know what is even going on with the solar panels. I've tried almost everything but I am going to get to the bottom of this! In the mean time, a little sneak peak of what's coming next in this mod!
Can somebody show me an use for the trunk?

That model you're working on already seems cool can't wait! A little note, my game laggs a bit when I move around the trunk But I'm assuming you're already on it ^^ Maybe add a stock shroud to the heatshield if you don't want to use the trunk, keep up the awsome work!

DeepslayLP,

The trunk can be used to what I think is to store a satalite to be into orbit or store life-support or supplies to a space station or maybe an extra fuel tank.

Also does anyone know how to fix this issue with the nodes being bigger than the part? Is there a part in the config that changes the size or something?

Some 5 minute progress on the texture. Can anyone guess what this is?

Is it a payload insertion device?

Is it a payload insertion device?

It's LADEE.

Also does anyone know how to fix this issue with the nodes being bigger than the part? Is there a part in the config that changes the size or something?

http://i.imgur.com/Rb1V7nm.jpg

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.13, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2
node_stack_top    = 0.0,  0.13, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2

It's the last number on the node definitions.

  • 0 = tiny nodes
  • 1 = small nodes
  • 2 = large nodes
  • 3 = etc...

This also affects the strength of the connection point (Though I wish visual node size and strength could be defined separate). For example, if you were to make a carrier rocket (Do it!) of a 3.75m diameter - a node size of 0 would equal spaghetti, but a node size of 3 would equal steady rocket (more or less).

LADEE is looking mighty fine!

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.13, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2
node_stack_top    = 0.0,  0.13, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2

It's the last number on the node definitions.

  • 0 = tiny nodes
  • 1 = small nodes
  • 2 = large nodes
  • 3 = etc...

This also affects the strength of the connection point (Though I wish visual node size and strength could be defined separate). For example, if you were to make a carrier rocket (Do it!) of a 3.75m diameter - a node size of 0 would equal spaghetti, but a node size of 3 would equal steady rocket (more or less).

EDIT:Also, trunk has no more lag! Will be in the next version!
